author: jeff
post: [T]he idea of it being authentic is “just too powerful.” Actually, there’s an awful lot of truth in that statement. It’s why opponents (I think the term fits) of the Shroud and other relics are so willfully determined to ignore any evidence favoring authenticity. They’re stuck in a cognitive loop: The Shroud  isn’t  real because it  can’t  be real, because if it is…well…it just  ISN’T  real..
title: The idea of something being authentic is "just too powerful"
